comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content: Spencer's Coal Importers, owners of the sailing ships Madcap and Zayda which were used as coal ships from south Wales into Waterford for decades..

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/63844591@N04] Were Spencer's Coal Importers based in Johnstown?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content: Yes, at corner of John Street and Waterside. Extended family farmed extensively around Waterford.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/63844591@N04] Thanks, I've moved the location up (down?) Johnstown to that corner...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: I remember Spencers Dairy in Johnstown, they used to deliver milk in a little blue Austin van back in the 1960's. This is roughly where the dairy was located, its long gone now. maps.google.com/maps?q=waterford+ireland&hl=en&ll...
